issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Cannot run instances because of invalid security group

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
While troubleshooting EUCA-8794, we ran into this condition where instance cannot reach the running state because the NC cannot download the image manifest from Walrus:

From NC:
{noformat}
2014-02-25 18:13:26  INFO 000011848 objectstorage_creator    | [i-e92c10e0] downloading http://10.111.1.14:8773/services/objectstorage/tmpaejjnqzrwa/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml
2014-02-25 18:13:26 DEBUG 000011848 objectstorage_creator    | /opt/eucalyptus/usr/share/eucalyptus/get_bundle /opt/eucalyptus http://10.111.1.14:8773/services/objectstorage/tmpaejjnqzrwa/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/cache/emi-1535917f-4ed41d69/blocks 1468006400 >> /tmp/euca_nc_unbundle.log 2>&1
2014-02-25 18:13:26 ERROR 000011848 objectstorage_creator    | [i-e92c10e0] failed on download and unbundle with command /opt/eucalyptus/usr/share/eucalyptus/get_bundle /opt/eucalyptus http://10.111.1.14:8773/services/objectstorage/tmpaejjnqzrwa/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/cache/emi-1535917f-4ed41d69/blocks 1468006400 >> /tmp/euca_nc_unbundle.log 2>&1
2014-02-25 18:13:26 ERROR 000011848 art_implement_tree       | [i-e92c10e0] failed to create artifact emi-1535917f-4ed41d69 (error=1, may retry) on try 1
{noformat}

From Walrus around the same time:

This is highly reproducible and occurred on fresh Eucalyptus installation since 2/24/2014.
fields.summary: Fail to run instance: fail to download image manifest

comments.body: Attaching SOS reports and system information/configuration. Instance "i-e92c10e0" can be used as an example to trace error in logs.

To reproduce the problem and get around EUCA-8794, you need a fresh Eucalyptus installation with the latest source and make sure that the first instance you run using "euca-run-instance" has the "-g default" in the request. This is to get you around the EUCA-8794 issue.

Appears to be an issue with file permissions on the NC.

When run with rootwrap the download call succeeds, without, run as eucalyptus user, it fails.

{code}[eucalyptus@a-25 tmp]$ /opt/eucalyptus/usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap /opt/eucalyptus/usr/share/eucalyptus/get_bundle /opt/eucalyptus http://10.111.5.50:8773/services/objectstorage/tmpy6qycejiwo/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml /disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/cache/emi-d378dd2c-f0cc53c8/blocks 1468006400 >> /tmp/euca_nc_unbundle.log

The bug is that the manifest is always being written to the local dir and ignoring the requested dir (where the parts are written to). 
This should be fixed with euca2ools commit 3c509c329240b13330c4518fb4bb4a25dff64f68.
get_bundle is no longer part of the codebase. And runs do work now.
